contentrichtext.text: '''UEA''' may stand for: == Universities == * [[University of East Africa]], established in June 1963 and split, in 1970, into [[University of Nairobi]], [[Makerere University]] and [[University of Dar es Salaam]] * [[University of East Anglia]], established in 1963, a university in Norwich, England * [[University of the State of Amazonas]] (''{{lang|pt|Universidade do Estado do Amazonas}}''), a university in Manaus, Brazil, established in 2001 from the University of Technology of Amazonas (''{{lang|pt|Universidade de Tecnologia do Amazonas}}'') * University of East Asia, reestablished in 1981 and renamed the [[University of Macau]] in 1991 == Other uses == * [[Urban Environmental Accords]], the United Nations accords signed in San Francisco on June 5, 2005, regarding sustainable environmental practices for cities. * [[World Esperanto Association]], (''{{lang|eo|Universala Esperanto-Asocio}}''), the worldwide organization of the Esperanto movement * [[Universal enveloping algebra]], a mathematical object * [[Utah Education Association]], the teachers' union in Utah * [[Uea]], a Melanesian island in the Rotuma group, a dependency of Fiji * In biology, UEA is an abbreviation for "''Ulex europaeus'' agglutinin" (or "''Ulex europaeus'' lectin"), the [[lectin]] of the [[gorse]] species ''Ulex europaeus'' {{disambiguation}} <!-- Long comment to avoid being listed on short pages -->
